intro: Eremurus caucasicus, commonly known as the Caucasian spirea, is a striking plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It is a member of the Xanthorrhoeaceae family and is characterized by its tall, spire-like inflorescence composed of numerous yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces a unique, hollow stem that can reach heights of up to 2 meters. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in rocky or alpine environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its dramatic floral display.
